question: What is the primary reason I might get an 'Invalid Credentials' error when trying to log in to the cloud service?
answer: You will get an 'Invalid Credentials' error if you have not specifically applied for and been granted a cloud project.

question: Where can I apply for a cloud project?
answer: You can apply for a cloud project using the 'CC cloud project and RAS request form' available at [https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeU_BoRk5cEz3AvVLf3e9yZJq-OvcFCQ-mg7p4AWXmUkd5rTw/viewform].

question: What should I do if I haven't received my cloud project confirmation email after more than 3 business days?
answer: If more than 3 business days have passed and you haven't received your confirmation email, submit a ticket to cloud@tech.alliancecan.ca including your name, institution, and the email address used for the request.

question: How can I find the correct login links for different cloud services?
answer: Login links for the different clouds can be found on the 'Cloud Wiki page' in the 'Using the Cloud' section. Your confirmation email will also specify which cloud is hosting your project.

question: What should I check if I have a confirmed cloud project but still cannot log in?
answer: Check the System status page to see if there is an incident affecting service on your cloud.

question: What username should I use to log in to the cloud service?
answer: You should use your username, the same as you would for an HPC cluster, and explicitly not your email address.

question: How can I test if my username or password is the issue when logging in?
answer: You can test logging in at [https://ccdb.computecanada.ca/security/login] to determine if the issue is with your username or password.

question: How do I reset my cloud service password if it's rejected?
What information should I include when submitting a ticket if I still can't log in after following all steps?
answer: Email cloud@tech.alliancecan.ca with your username, project name, which cloud you are trying to access, and a description of the steps you've taken so far.

question: What is the first thing to check if my virtual machine (VM) won't launch?
answer: First, check to see if launching the VM would exceed any resource limits or quotas for VMs, CPUs, or GBs of RAM on your cloud project.

question: How can I check my resource limits or quotas for my cloud project?
answer: Log in to your project cloud dashboard, navigate to the left-side menu, click 'Compute', then 'Overview' to see your allotted resources and current usage.

question: Where can I request more resources for my cloud project if needed?
answer: You can request more resources for your project using the form available at [https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeU_BoRk5cEz3AvVLf3e9yZJq-OvcFCQ-mg7p4AWXmUkd5rTw/viewform].

question: What does the error message 'Error: No valid host was found. There are not enough hosts available.' indicate when launching a VM?
answer: This error often indicates that you may have chosen an inappropriate Availability Zone or that there aren't enough hosts available in your selected zone.

question: How can I resolve the 'No valid host was found' error related to Availability Zones?
answer: Fix this by setting the Availability Zone back to the default option, 'Any Availability Zone', in the 'Details' section when launching the instance.

question: If I still get the 'not enough hosts' error or need a specific Availability Zone, what should I do?
answer: Send an email to cloud@tech.alliancecan.ca and provide the cloud name, project name, the steps you have taken, and the reason why you need a particular availability zone if applicable.

question: What information should I provide if I submit a ticket because my VM still won't boot after troubleshooting?
answer: Submit a ticket to cloud@tech.alliancecan.ca with your username, project name, cloud name, and any information you collected during troubleshooting.
